summary:
From the rustic streets of a town in Southern Pakistan to the notorious alleyways of Amsterdam, I have come quite a way. I couldn't even imagine that attending an air force public school at the age of 12 would somehow lead me to working for the premiere marketing agency in Pakistan, Interflow. Working with high-profile clients, scripting creative stories, and extensive media-work was all so unexpected but that wasn't the end of surprises for me. A year later, I was running an electoral campaign in a university I had only ever heard legends about. I went on to become the representative for the Faculty of Economics and Business in the Central Student Council at the University of Amsterdam and followed on to work as an FP&A Analyst for Just Eat Takeaway.com; an industry leader in online food delivery platforms. I joined while we were still Takeaway.com and saw the company make one astronomical leap after the other and tried my best to imbibe that very spirit, one astronomical leap after the other. I presently work as an FP&A Manager for Coty; not to flex (too much anyway) but another industry leader undergoing amazing transformation and on it's way up with potential unveiling each day. 

The above mentioned story was all meticulously designed to make a point. The point being that there is nothing beyond my scope of abilities except using chopsticks and you will be glad to know that I have not yet given up on that endeavor either. I am an individual with a voracious appetite for knowledge and an immense love for the process. I truly believe in thinking bigger than even what one's grasp may seem, for as long as we we are willing to truly dedicate, we all possess the ability to do something... remarkable. 
              
If I can be of service to you in any of the aforementioned affairs or if you can finally teach me how to use chopsticks, please feel free to contact me here or on my email address: devalraj1@gmail.com. Looking forward to connecting with you!

awards.title: Best Across Six Cambridge IGCSE's- First Position

profile_positions.description: I was promoted for my performance after having been taken full-time. My role retained its signature ability to adapt quickly and cater to a wide array of requests. In a business as dynamic as Just Eat Takeaway.com and for an individual as hungry to constantly learn and grow, that served as a highly potent weapon. I got increasingly involved in strategic business projects and planning, and with each day, I got to do something different and challenging than the day before. It ranged anything from redefining order forecasts to breaking existing molds of AOV planning. It ranged from training new-hires in system to establishing best practises on on-boarding. That's the charm of working in a high growth environment, it goes from 0 to a 100 really quickly, and when it does, I am strapped in and ready to go.
profile_positions.title: FP&A Analyst

profile_positions.description:
As soon as I finished my bachelors, I was taken full-time to allow me to fully come into my role as an FP&A Analyst. My increased availability allowed me to gain more knowledge about the business and the craft of FP&A, which then enabled me to assist with more strategic projects than ever before. I handed-over my Anaplan responsibilities to our designated systems incharge and looked to improve myself in other facets. 

My duties and responsibilities included but were not limited to the following:
1) Central budgeting, re-forecasting and variance oversight of KPIs across all takeaway markets
2) Creating various monthly and yearly deliverables for Staff Cost, OPEX and Working Capital monitoring
3) Cost Centre oversight for a major Takeaway department, IT
4) Modeling and presenting strategic annual budgeting/forecasting and assisting in higher level central 3 year to 5 year business plans
5) Ad hoc tasks for team lead and fp&a director
profile_positions.title: Junior FP&A Analyst

profile_positions.description:
After having finished my internship period, I was taken on as a part-time employee which assisted me in striking a healthier work-study balance. Though the hours were fewer, the nature of my responsibilities went up a notch as I gained experience, and I wouldn't have had it any other way. A memorable moment came about when I was offered a permanent contract while working only part-time and still being a student. It was a reflection of the faith the organisation had in me, which sent my confidence and ambition through the roof. All through covid and trying to finish my bachelors, I persevered and *spoiler-alert* it was all about to pay off. 
 
My duties and responsibilities included but were not limited to the following:
1) Continued Anaplan system maintenance and data loads
2) Central budgeting, re-forecasting and variance oversight of KPIs across all takeaway markets
3) Producing monthly reports for the senior management to assist in financial and operation oversight 
4) Creating various monthly and yearly deliverables for Staff Cost, OPEX and Working Capital monitoring
5) Cost Centre oversight for a major Takeaway department, IT
6) Ad hoc tasks for team lead and fp&a director
profile_positions.title: Junior FP&A Analyst

profile_positions.description:
I started my career in finance as an FP&A Intern for what was then "Takeaway.com" and it was the perfect launching pad. The business grew at an incredible pace, which made for a very solid and versatile foundation as far as FP&A knowledge and practise was concerned. Quite early on, this position made it abundantly clear to me what working in a fast-paced, highly demanding and dynamic workplace entail. Doing so alongside pursuing a full-time bachelors degree was not without its set of challenges, but as Takeaway greatly embodies and I echo, there is no growth in the comfort zone. 

My duties and responsibilities included but were not limited to the following:

1) Systems maintenance and monthly data loads for our primary FP&A system, Anaplan.
2) Producing monthly reports for senior management to aid key oversight on Financial's and KPI's
3) Month-end reviews of specific cost centres 
4) A wide array of ad-hoc requests from the FP&A team lead and senior management on everything from P&L line items to KPI's
5) Ad-hoc organisation tasks such as team events etc.
profile_positions.title: Financial Planning and Analysis Intern

profile_positions.description: I was the Faculty Student Council Representative for the faculty of economics and business in the Central Student Council. My major task was to liaison between the Faculty Student Council and the Central Student Council alongside taking up files and dossiers on both ends. My goal was to ensure that the communication between the two organs flows uninterrupted so that together, we could create a better and more conducive study environment.
profile_positions.title: Faculty Student Coucnil Representative

profile_positions.description: I was the Task-force Head for the Facilities and Housing task-force at the Centrale Studentraad UvA. My duties included conducting and heading meetings internally with the members of the task-force as well as interacting with the members of the executive board and the facilities services at UvA in order to ensure and improve the notion of student well-being. The taskforce usually concerns itself with the practicalities of the student life and has files such as student housing, study places, cafeteria etc. Our prime goal was to ascertain that the practicalities of the student life always progress seamlessly so that a student can focus and thrive academically as well as professionally.
profile_positions.title: Taskforce Head Facilities and Housing - Centrale Studentraad UvA

profile_positions.description: I assisted List Sefa- a student party- in drafting its election campaign and participating in the elections themselves. I contended as well and was elected into the faculty council as a result.
profile_positions.title: Committee Assistant - List Sefa

profile_positions.description: I was assigned to intern for the creative department at Interflow Communications and was actively engaged in the brainstorming for and crafting of advertising campaigns for national companies.
profile_positions.title: Creative Intern

volunteer_experiences.description: The trust operates multiple eye care hospitals across the country and I was amazed by the sheer size of the operations. Hundreds of people had their lives improved each day and it was always an honor and a privilege serving them.

The Hunar Foundation conducts efforts in setting up vocational training centers in rural settings of Pakistan to economically empower the marginalized segments of the society. Assisting in their efforts helped me truly realize the importance of acquiring a skill and being able to monetize it
I volunteered for one of the schools being operated by TCF and very few things are as morally rewarding as working with young minds and imparting education to them.

Under this volunteering experience, I got to spend time with kids with certain psychological barriers resulting from traumatic experiences or a general dearth of care and attention as they grew up. Trying to socially empower them and help nurture them is not only morally rewarding but also a light-bearer on how parenting or the lack of it can upset the fairly fragile fabrics of a child’s mind.
